questions.text: A dye factory worker with a history of benzidine exposure undergoes cystoscopy. What is the appropriate management?
questions.correct_answer: B. Cystoscopy with removal of tumor

questions.text: A 47-year-old woman comes to the office due to fever, dysuria, and abdominal pain. The patient has had several urinary tract infections since her teens but has no other medical concerns. Physical examination shows mild suprapubic discomfort. Urinalysis demonstrates pyuria and many bacteria. CT scan of the abdomen is shown in the image below: Which of the following structures has most likely limited the proper ascent of the anomalous organ seen on CT scan?
Which of the following investigations does not use ionizing radiation?
Correctly match the statement regarding the splint shown in image.

options.label: A
options.text: Knuckle bender splint; Ulnar Nerve Palsy

options.label: B
options.text: Dynamic cock up splint; Radial Nerve Palsy

options.label: C
options.text: Turn buckle splint; Volkmann’s Ischemic Contracture

options.label: D
options.text: Knuckle bender splint; Median Nerve Palsy

questions.correct_answer: B. Dynamic cock up splint; Radial Nerve Palsy
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Dynamic cock up splint; Radial Nerve Palsy

questions.text: A 28-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 3-month history of pain in his left shoulder. He is physically active and plays baseball twice a week. The pain is reproduced when the shoulder is externally rotated against resistance. Injury of which of the following tendons is most likely in this patient?

A 55-year-old man comes to the physician because of swelling and unusual heaviness of his scrotum that he first noticed a few weeks ago. The symptoms improve when he is lying in bed. He also reports a 5-kg weight loss and increasing fatigue over the past 6 months. He has smoked 1 pack of cigarettes daily for the past 15 years. Physical examination shows tenderness to palpation of his right flank. There are soft strands palpable in the right hemiscrotum superior of the right testis. The strands increase with Valsalva maneuver. Applying a bright light to the right hemiscrotum shows no transillumination. Obstruction of venous drainage into which of the following vessels is most likely responsible for this patient's scrotal enlargement?

A 55-year-old male presents with complaints of pain in the calf muscles after walking for a certain distance. The pain is relieved by rest and reoccurs upon resuming walking. Based on Boyd’s classification, what is the most likely grade?
Following head trauma, patient opens eyes to pain, localize pain on right and withdraws on left side, and speaks incoherent words. His GCS is:

A 19-year-old man comes to the physician because of episodic tingling and numbness in his right hand for the past 3 weeks. He says that he cannot hold a pen very well and that this is affecting his handwriting. Sensation to light touch is decreased over the right little finger and the medial palmar surface of the right hand. Radiologic evaluation in this patient is most likely to show a fracture in which of the following bones?
A patient presented with dysphagia to both solid and liquids. Manometry revealed IRP > 15 and >20% premature spastic contractions but no peristalsis. What is the diagnosis?

Identify the wrong component: 1) Thoracoscore – Priority of surgery 2) ASESPIS score-Induration 3) Kings college criteria-Jaundice <7 days before development of encephalopathy 4) Van Nuys grading-Invasion
A 30-year-old female came to the OPD with complaints of backache. On examination, her eyes and pinna revealed blackish discoloration. What is the likely diagnosis?
A person at the airport with symptoms showing agitations showed following x - ray findings. He was carrying enema apparatus and laxatives. Which of the following is a wrong statement?

options.label: D
options.text: He is at risk of poisoning

questions.text: A 41-year-old woman comes to the doctor because of gradually progressive weakness in her right hand over the past few weeks. She goes to the gym to lift weights 5 times a week. With the dorsum of the right hand on a flat surface, the patient is unable to move her thumb to touch a pen held 2 cm above the interphalangeal joint of the thumb. An MRI of the right arm shows compression of a nerve that passes through the pronator teres muscle. Based on the examination findings, loss of innervation of which of the following muscles is most likely in this patient?

A 38-year-old man was thrown from his motor-cycle and brought to the emergency department by emergency medical services. The paramedics report his initial blood pressure was 83/52 mm Hg, pulse was 128/min, and respiratory rate was 33/min. He was given 2 L of lactated Ringer’s solution en route. On arrival to the trauma bay his blood pressure is 108/76 mm Hg, pulse is 105/min, and respiratory rate is 28/min. On examination pelvic compression elicits severe pain, and blood is noted at the urethral meatus. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in evaluating the blood at the urethral meatus?
An adolescent fell on an outstretched hand. For management, the doctor ties a cast as shown in the given image. Which fracture did the patient suffer from?

Following a major road accident, a 25-year-old male is stabilized in casualty. He is noticed to have abdominal bruising, for which a CECT abdomen is done. A zone 1 retroperitoneal hematoma is found. In suspected abdominal aortic injury, exposure is achieved via which manoeuvre?
A 35-year-old female presents with a mobile, rubbery mass in her left breast. A histological image is provided. What is the most likely diagnosis for the given image?

Seven hours after undergoing left hip arthroplasty for chronic hip pain, a 67-year-old woman reports a prickling sensation in her left anteromedial thigh and lower leg. Neurologic examination shows left leg strength 3/5 on hip flexion and 2/5 on knee extension. Patellar reflex is decreased on the left. Sensation to pinprick and light touch are decreased on the anteromedial left thigh as well as medial lower leg. Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of this patient's symptoms?
A 50 year old patient with a history of achalasia, had undergone a POEM, following which he developed left sided chest pain. HRCT is shown below. What is the likely diagnosis?
Choose the incorrect statement regarding the given image:

options.label: C
options.text: There is no restriction of movement

questions.text: A 20-year-old male patient presents with pain on movement. X-ray of knee joint shows lytic lesion on the upper end of fibula as shown. What is the likely diagnosis?
All of the following are correctly paired with HU on CT except:

A previously healthy 2-year-old boy is brought to the emergency room by his mother because of persistent crying and refusal to move his right arm. The episode began 30 minutes ago after the mother lifted him up by the arms. He appears distressed and is inconsolable. On examination, his right arm is held close to his body in a flexed and pronated position. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

Identify the correct statements Annual risk of adenocarcinoma in Barrett’s esophagus with low grade dysplasia is 0.7% per year. The iliohypogastric nerve is most commonly injured during Rutherford-Morrison incision Muscularis propria breached in Carcinoma rectum is Duke Stage A. Replaced right hepatic artery arising from superior mesenteric artery is the most common vascular anomaly of the liver.
Steps of surgery of DDH in a child < 2 years: A. Capsulotomy B. Femoral osteotomy C. Identification of true acetabulum using round ligament D. Placing the head back into acetabulum
Arrange the sequence of damage control surgery: Hemorrhage control Definitive repair Abdomen closure Resuscitation in ICU

A 75-year-old female presents to emergency department with pain in right hip and is unable to walk. She gives a history of fall in bathroom. On examination, you observe that there is shortening of left lower limb and is externally rotated. There is no history of arthritis. X-ray of hip is given below. What will be the management?

A male newborn is born at 37 weeks' gestation after spontaneous vaginal delivery. The mother had no prenatal care. Physical examination shows a urethral opening on the dorsal aspect of the penis, 4 mm proximal to the glans. The physical appearance is shown below. Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of this patient's findings?

options.label: B
options.text: Incomplete union of the labioscrotal swellings

questions.correct_answer: C. Malpositioning of the genital tubercle

questions.text: Identify the anti-reflux procedure in the image:
A patient underwent endoscopy. During the procedure perforation occurred at 25 cm from the incisors. Which structure is likely to be damaged?

A 62-year-old man with a history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and diabetes presents to the emergency department with chest pain that began approximately 2 hours ago. He describes the pain as a pressure-like sensation in the center of his chest that radiates to his left arm. He also reports shortness of breath and nausea. On physical exam, his blood pressure is 160/90 mmHg, heart rate is 100 beats per minute, and respiratory rate is 22 breaths per minute. The ECG shows ST-segment depression in leads II, III, and aVF. Troponin levels are elevated. What test can detect areas of reversible myocardial ischemia in this patient?

A 45-year-old woman presents with sudden onset dyspnea and left-sided chest pain. On physical examination, you note decreased breath sounds on the left side. Chest radiography is performed. Which of the following is least likely to cause an opaque left hemithorax on the radiograph of this patient?

A 62-year-old man with gastroesophageal reflux disease and osteoarthritis is brought to the emergency department because of a 1-hour history of severe, stabbing epigastric pain. For the last 6 months, he has had progressively worsening right knee pain, for which he takes ibuprofen several times a day. He has smoked half a pack of cigarettes daily for 25 years. The lungs are clear to auscultation. An ECG shows sinus tachycardia without ST-segment elevations or depressions. This patient is most likely to have referred pain in which of the following locations?
A 45 year old male patient underwent a routine USG following which this finding was noted. What is false regarding this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Cetrimide, Hypertonic saline may be used for PAIR

options.label: C
options.text: PAIR is the treatment of choice in cysto-biliary communication

options.label: D
options.text: Echinococcus granulosus parasite is the most common causative agent

questions.correct_answer: C. PAIR is the treatment of choice in cysto-biliary communication
questions.explanation: Ans. C) PAIR is the treatment of choice in cysto-biliary communication.

questions.text: Identify the nerve supply of the marked muscle:
A newborn baby presents with continuous dribbling of saliva and choking while feeding. CXR is shown here. Identify the type of TEF:
Identify the MRI sequence?

A 4-month-old male infant is brought to the physician by his father because of swelling of his left hemiscrotum. Physical examination shows a nontender left scrotal mass that transilluminates. The mass increases in size when the boy cries but is easily reducible. Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of this patient's findings?
A male child presented with vomiting at 3 weeks of age. An X ray was taken that shows the following: What is false regarding the above condition?

options.label: A
options.text: If presented late, dehydration requiring resuscitation and weight loss predominate

options.label: B
options.text: USG is the best investigation to diagnose

options.label: C
options.text: Peristalsis from left to right side of abdomen may be seen on feeding

questions.text: Which of the following procedure is done for the treatment of Pilonidal sinus as shown?

A 33-year-old male patient was brought to the trauma centre following a road traffic accident. He was walking on the street when a car hit him from the side and severely injured his left knee. An X-ray of the knee joint showing distal femur and proximal tibia-fibula was done. Identify the given fracture:

Arrange the following external fixators used for treatment of fracture of tibia in order of increasing stability: I. Ilizarov II. Uniplanar frame with one rod III. Biplanar frame IV. Uniplanar frame with two rods

A 14-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his mother because of a 2-month history of pain in his right leg. His mother has been giving him ketorolac at night to improve his sleep, but the pain has not improved. Physical examination shows marked tenderness along the right mid-femur. An x-ray of the right lower extremity is shown below. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
All of these are components of Barcelona Clinic for Liver Cancer (BCLC) staging except:
Identify what is depicted in the abdominal X-Ray?
According to the Strasberg’s classification of bile leaks, leak from an aberrant right posterior sectoral duct comes under?
Which of the following is not a utility of ultrasound imaging?
questions.correct_answer: C. Treatment of coronary artery disease
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Treatment of coronary artery disease

questions.text: A 67-year-old man presents to his physician's office for evaluation of a 9-month history of pain in the midline of his lower back. X-ray is shown below. Further evaluation is most likely to show which of the following sets of laboratory findings?

options.label: A
options.text: Calcium increased, Phosphate decreased, ALP increased, PTH increased

options.label: B
options.text: Calcium normal, Phosphate normal, ALP normal, PTH normal

options.label: C
options.text: Calcium normal, Phosphate normal, ALP increased, PTH normal

options.label: D
options.text: Calcium normal, Phosphate increased, ALP increased, PTH increased

questions.correct_answer: C. Calcium normal, Phosphate normal, ALP increased, PTH normal

questions.text: What is the procedure being shown below?
A patient is diagnosed with varicose veins comes to OPD with complaints of eczema over the same region. What is the stage of the clinical classification according to the CEAP guidelines?

A 32-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 3-week history of a painless testicular mass that he first noticed while showering. Physical examination of the right testicle shows a firm, fixed, nontender 2-cm nodule. Ultrasound shows a well-defined, homogenous, hypoechoic 2.3 cm lesion in the right testicle. Laboratory studies show increased serum concentrations of hCG and placental alkaline phosphatase, and a serum alpha-fetoprotein concentration that is within the reference range. Right radical inguinal orchiectomy is performed. A photomicrograph of a section of the removed testis is shown. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

6-year-old boy is brought to the OPD for evaluation of back pain. The pain has been constant for the last 2 weeks and keeps the patient from playing with his friends. He wakes up several times nightly to void and has had episodes of incontinence as the leg pain prevents him from walking to the bathroom. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 23-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department because of sudden onset of severe knee pain and swelling that began 30 minutes earlier while she was at soccer practice. She was running down the field, suddenly "cut inwards", and heard a loud pop when she first felt the pain. She is unable to bear weight on the right knee. Examination shows marked edema and tenderness to palpation of the anterior right knee. When the knee is flexed and anterior traction is provided to the foreleg, anterior translation of the foreleg is observed. An illustration of a normal right knee in anterior view is shown. The most likely cause of this patient's condition is injury to which of the following labelled structures?
In extended left hemi-hepatectomy, the liver segments resected are:

Patient had difficulty in walking upstairs. When he was made to bear weight on right lower limb, the left-sided pelvis dropped down, but when he was standing on the left lower limb, the right-sided pelvis moved up. Which of the following is the likely lesion?
questions.correct_answer: A. Right superior gluteal nerve palsy

questions.text: A 54-year-old woman underwent surgery for breast carcinoma last year. She now presents to her oncologist with painless swelling involving her left arm, which started a few weeks 2 ago. Upon examination, the affected arm appears swollen and feels heavy, with visible thickening of the skin. There is no warmth, redness, or tenderness. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Identify the radiological procedure shown below?

An 18-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 4-week history of pain in his left foot that increases with physical activity and improves with rest. He is a military recruit who started his basic combat training 6 weeks ago. Before he began military training, he did not exercise regularly. He is 178 cm (5 ft 10 in) tall and weighs 60 kg (132 lb); his BMI is 19 kg/m. Physical examination shows mild swelling, erythema, and tenderness to palpation over the forefoot. An x-ray of the left foot is shown. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A 35 Y/f presents with bleeding during defecation and straining. Examination reveals pile mass which appears on straining, at 7 and 1 1 O'clock , which reduces spontaneously. Preferred treatment:
Identify the most common neurological complication following ligation of the Inferior mesenteric artery during abdominoperineal resection for rectal carcinoma?

options.label: A
options.text: Parasympathetic bladder dysfunction and retrograde ejaculation.

options.label: C
options.text: Sympathetic retrograde ejaculation and bladder dysfunction.

options.label: D
options.text: Sympathetic Impotence and loss of cutaneous sensation in perineal region

questions.correct_answer: C. Sympathetic retrograde ejaculation and bladder dysfunction.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Sympathetic retrograde ejaculation and bladder dysfunction.

questions.text: A diabetic patient presents with sudden-onset perineal pain. On examination, foul-smelling discharge, and necrotic tissue as seen in the image is noted. Which of the following is true about the given condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Anti-gas gangrene serum indicated for all cases

options.label: B
options.text: Urinary diversion is the next step

questions.correct_answer: D. Mixed aerobic and anaerobic infection
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Mixed aerobic and anaerobic infection

questions.text: A patient presents in OPD with a history of fever and cough for 5 days. On auscultation, crepts were heard on right side. Chest X-ray is given below. Mark the correct finding in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Apical segment of Right lower lobe consolidation

options.label: C
options.text: Posterior segment of right lower lobe consolidation

questions.text: A 6-year-old girl is brought to the emergency department because of right elbow swelling and pain 30 minutes after falling onto her outstretched right arm. She has been unable to move her right elbow since the fall. Physical examination shows bruising, swelling, and tenderness of the right elbow; range of motion is limited by pain. An x-ray of the right arm shows a supracondylar fracture of the humerus with anterior displacement of the proximal fragment. Further evaluation is most likely to show which of the following findings?
Which of these is incorrect about management of hepatoma?

options.label: A
options.text: Milan criteria is applicable for single tumor up to 5 cm or three tumors each less than 3 cm

options.label: B
options.text: A FLR (future liver remnant) of at least 40% normal liver is a pre-requisite for resection

options.label: C
options.text: Colorectal metastasis to liver can be excised

options.label: D
options.text: Percutaneous ablation is used for hepatomas

questions.correct_answer: B. A FLR (future liver remnant) of at least 40% normal liver is a pre-requisite for resection
questions.explanation: Ans. B) A FLR (future liver remnant) of at least 40% normal liver is a pre-requisite for resection

questions.text: What is the likely diagnosis based on the given image?

29-year-old man comes to the emergency department with persistent vomiting and abdominal pain for the last 24 hours. The pain is crampy, difuse, and getting worse. He had a normal bowel movement 3 days ago and has no diarrhea. His abdomen is distended with hyperactive bowel sounds. Percussion reveals tympany, and the patient is diffusely tender to palpation. There is no rebound tenderness or guarding. X-ray is shown below. Which of the following historical findings would most likely be seen in this patient?

A 6-year-old child with a history of transient ischemic attacks and several episodes of weakness is referred for diagnostic evaluation. On physical examination, there is a noticeable murmur around the child's temple. Digital Subtraction Angiography (DSA) is performed, revealing the characteristic imaging shown.The following appearance of DSA is seen in:

A 58-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 4-day history of abdominal pain and vomiting. Initially, the vomitus was food that he had recently eaten, but it is now bilious. He has had similar complaints several times in the past 6 years. He has smoked 1 pack of cigarettes daily for the past 25 years and drinks 3 pegs of whiskey daily. He is 160 cm (5 ft 3 in) tall and weighs 48 kg (105 lb); BMI is 19 kg/m2. His vital signs are within normal limits. Physical examination shows an epigastric mass.The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities. Which of the following is the most likely

A 57-year-old white man is brought to the emergency department by ambulance because of sudden-onset, bright red emesis. His blood pressure is 80/40 mm Hg and heart rate is 124/min. Physical examination is notable for jaundice and an enlarged abdomen that is dull to percussion and positive for a fluid wave. Which of the following vessel anastomoses is responsible for the patient’s bleeding?

options.label: A
options.text: Left gastric vein and azygos vein

options.label: B
options.text: Paraumbilical vein and inferior epigastric vein

options.label: C
options.text: Portal vein and inferior vena cava

options.label: D
options.text: Splenic vein and left renal vein

questions.correct_answer: A. Left gastric vein and azygos vein
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Left gastric vein and azygos vein

questions.text: A 60-year-old patient has been diagnosed with proximal transverse colon carcinoma. The physician recommends an extended right colectomy as a treatment option. Which arteries should be resected during an extended right colectomy to prevent the spread of cancer in proximal transverse colon carcinoma?

options.label: A
options.text: Ileocolic, right colic and branch of middle colic

options.label: B
options.text: Ileocolic, right colic, stem of middle colic, left colic

options.label: C
options.text: Ileocolic, right colic and trunk of middle colic

questions.correct_answer: C. Ileocolic, right colic and trunk of middle colic
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Ileocolic, right colic and trunk of middle colic.

questions.text: 50-year-old obese female presents to the emergency department with severe right upper quadrant pain, fever, and nausea. The physician suspects acute cholecystitis and orders imaging studies to confirm the diagnosis. Which of the following statements is not true about acute cholecystitis?

options.label: A
options.text: Gall bladder thickness > 3 mm on USG

options.label: D
options.text: Preferential visualization of gall bladder in HIDA scan

questions.correct_answer: D. Preferential visualization of gall bladder in HIDA scan
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Preferential visualization of gall bladder in HIDA scan.

questions.text: What is the management of choice for aneurysms performed by interventional radiologists?

A 68-year-old man comes to the physician for a wellness visit. Physical examination shows an enlarged and nodular prostate. Laboratory studies show elevated levels of prostate-specific antigen. A prostate biopsy confirms the diagnosis of prostate cancer, and a radical prostatectomy is planned. This patient should be counselled on the increased risk of injury to which of the following structures?

While performing a cholecystectomy, surgeons ensure that dissection is performed above this particular line, since the cystic artery and cystic duct lie antero-superior to this line and the CBD lies below this line. The line mentioned in this question connects which 2 parts?

options.label: A
options.text: Rouviere’s sulcus to segment 5 of liver

options.label: B
options.text: Rouviere’s sulcus to segment 4 of liver

questions.correct_answer: B. Rouviere’s sulcus to segment 4 of liver
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Rouviere’s sulcus to segment 4 of liver

questions.text: In a patient who presents to the casualty with an RTA, what is the correct sequence of management?

options.label: A
options.text: Cervical spine stabilization, intubation, IV cannulation, CECT

options.label: B
options.text: Intubation, cervical spine stabilization, IV cannulation, CECT

options.label: C
options.text: IV cannulation, cervical spine stabilization, intubation, CECT

options.label: D
options.text: IV cannulation, intubation, CECT, cervical spine stabilization

questions.correct_answer: A. Cervical spine stabilization, intubation, IV cannulation, CECT
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Cervical spine stabilization, intubation, IV cannulation, CECT

questions.text: What is the most frequent cause of adrenal incidentaloma?

A 35-year-old patient presents to the emergency department with acute onset shortness of breath following a motor vehicle accident. Bedside ultrasonography is performed, and the image shown is obtained using M-mode. Which of the following signs is most likely being depicted in this ultrasound image?

A 25-year-old man comes to the physician because of right wrist pain after a fall from a ladder. Physical examination shows decreased grip strength and tenderness between the tendons of abductor pollicis longus and extensor pollicis brevis. X-ray of the right wrist shows no abnormalities. This patient is at increased risk for which of the following complications?

options.label: A
options.text: Paralysis of the abductor pollicis brevis muscle

options.label: C
options.text: Avascular necrosis of the lunate bone

questions.correct_answer: B. Osteoarthritis of the radiocarpal joint

questions.text: A 43-year-old multiparous woman with no other medical history presents to her physician because of crampy abdominal pain, fever, and jaundice. Laboratory studies show: Total bilirubin: 4.8 mg/dL Direct bilirubin: 4.2 mg/dL Amylase: 50 U/L Lipase: 70 U/L Aspartate aminotransferase: 75 U/L Alanine aminotransferase: 70 U/L The patient subsequently is sent for endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography; results are shown in the image. What is the most likely cause of the obstruction seen in the image?
Identify the image?

A 52-year-old female patient present with 4 cm diameter diagnosed breast cancer lesion with ipsilateral axillary and contralateral supraclavicular lymphadenopathy as shown below. As per AJCC system, patient belongs to which stage of breast cancer?
A surgeon returns the entire hernial sac into the abdominal cavity of a patient with an inguinal hernia without reducing its contents. What is this known as?

An 80-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department for right hip pain 30 minutes after she fell while walking around in her room. Examination shows groin tenderness. The range of motion of the hip is limited because of pain. An X-ray is shown below. Which of the following arteries was most likely damaged in the patient's fall?

A 45 year old patient underwent a lap cholecystectomy for gallstones. On day 2 in the postoperative period, he experienced fever and pain in the right hypochondrium. Ultrasonography reveals 200cc of fluid in the GB fossa. What is your next step?
A patient presents to the OPD with an ulcerative lesion noted near the nose. What is the probable diagnosis?
Identify the marked ligament?

A 22-year-old man comes to the physician because of a progressive swelling and pain in his right ring finger for the past 2 days. The pain began while playing football, when his finger got caught in the jersey of another player who forcefully pulled away. Examination shows that the right ring finger is extended. There is pain and swelling at the distal interphalangeal joint. When the patient is asked to make a fist, his right ring finger does not flex at the distal interphalangeal joint. There is no joint laxity. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Rupture of the flexor digitorum profundus tendon at its point of insertion

options.label: B
options.text: Closed fracture of the distal phalanx

options.label: C
options.text: Rupture of the extensor digitorum tendon at its point of insertion

options.label: D
options.text: Inflammation of the flexor digitorum profundus tendon sheath

questions.correct_answer: A. Rupture of the flexor digitorum profundus tendon at its point of insertion

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman who is breastfeeding her 2-month-old infant presents to the clinic with a painful, red, and swollen lump in her right breast. She reports having a fever and feeling unwell for the past 24 hours. On examination, there is a tender, fluctuant mass in the upper outer quadrant of breast. What will be the next best investigation to evaluate this patient?

A 76-year-old man who has had multiple episodes of pancreatitis presents to his physician’s office with mild epigastric pain and 9.1-kg weight loss over the past 6 months. The patient also describes daily foul-smelling stools that “float” in the toilet bowl. CT of the patient is shown below. Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment?
In which of the given cases is this procedure usually performed?
questions.correct_answer: C. BCT in node negative patients
questions.explanation: Ans. C) BCT in node negative patients

questions.text: A 66-year-old man comes to the physician for a follow-up examination after a below-knee amputation of the right lower leg. Three weeks ago, he had an acute arterial embolism that could not be revascularized in time to save the leg. He now reports episodic hot, shooting, and tingling pain in the right lower leg that began shortly after the amputation. He has type 2 diabetes mellitus. He has smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for the past 30 years. His current medications are metformin and prophylactic subcutaneous heparin. His temperature is 37.1°C (98.8°F), pulse is 78/min, and blood pressure is 135/88 mm Hg. Physical examination shows a slightly erythematous stump with clean sutures. The skin overlying the stump is warm and well-perfused. Muscle strength and sensation are normal throughout the remaining extremity and the left lower extremity. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A 55-year-old man presents with a mass in the right kidney on a CECT scan, as shown below. What is the diagnosis?

A 10-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his parents for a follow-up examination. He has had a short stature since birth and underwent diagnostic testing. Genetic analyses showed a gain of function mutation in the fibroblast growth factor receptor 3 (FGFR3) gene. He has met all developmental milestones. He is at the 10th percentile for height and 90th percentile for weight. Which of the following additional findings is most likely on physical examination?
The following CXR appearance is seen in:
A patient following head injury with altered consciousness, vomiting, and GCS of 10/15 undergoes CT scan as shown. What is the next step?
Which of these is not a risk factor for cholangiocarcinoma?

An otherwise healthy 8-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department by his mother 2 hours after the sudden onset of scrotal pain. Physical examination shows nontender testes and a tender, 5-mm, bluish nodule at the superior pole of the left testis. The patient undergoes urgent surgical exploration of the scrotum. During the operation, the nodule on the superior pole of the testis is found to be necrotic. In the process of embryologic development, this nodule forms as a result of the activity of which of the following?
Which of these is the most common type of hernia in females?

A 70-year-old man with a history of constipation has been experiencing intermittent left - sided abdominal pain and fevers for 2 days. He came to the emergency department immediately after he noticed blood in his toilet this morning. His heart rate is 110/min, blood pressure is 90/50 mm Hg, respiratory rate is 18/ min, and oxygen saturation is 95% on room air. On physical examination the physician notes copious amounts of bright red blood per rectum. The physician immediately places two large bore intravenous lines, administers fluid, and sends blood for type and screen. Which of the following is the most likely appearance of the patient’s condition?
